thread.title: Newcastle Start-Up Week kicks off with rallying call to new businesses

author: Graeme Whitfield
title: Newcastle Start-Up Week kicks off with rallying call to new businesses
text:
Paul Lancaster from Plan Digital UK (Photo: Newcastle Chronicle) Share Get business updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A week-long series of events designed to encourage more start-up businesses in the North East has kicked off with a call to arms for budding entrepreneurs in the region. 
Newcastle Start-Up Week has been organised by former Tech North and Sage executive Paul Lancaster in a bid to help people thinking of starting a new company to take the plunge. 
The event has kicked off with a launch at Newcastle’s Boiler Shop and will be followed by a series of talks from experts in all areas of business taking place around the city over the next five days. 
Introducing the week, Mr Lancaster said: “I’ve been helping people to start their own businesses for the last 15 years. I finally started mine last year. 
“I’ve wanted to do that for five years but I never felt I was quite ready. I’d read all the books, I’ve got great friends who are entrepreneurs but I still didn’t feel it was quite the right time for me. Launch of Newcastle start-up week at Boiler Shop (Photo: Trinity Mirror) 
“It occurred to me that if I felt like that, what about everyone else? What we’re trying to do in this week is put on a plate in five days the sort of thing you need to know to start a business that would normally take you five weeks or five months to learn. 
“Newcastle Start-Up Week is a great showcase for all the great support that exists in the North East to help people start up their own business.” 
Newcastle Start-Up Week is being supported by a range of organisations including the North East LEP, computing firm Sage, the Federation of Small Businesses, Invest Newcastle, and regional technology groups Dynamo, Digital Union and Sunderland Software City. 
High profile professional services companies including blusky chartered accountants, Northstar Ventures, Muckle LLP, KPMG, RBS, Stellium Data Centres, Zerolight and Filamanet PR have also provided sponsorship. Launch of Newcastle start-up week at Boiler Shop (Photo: Trinity Mirror) 
After today’s launch, the week will see sessions provided on getting started in business, funding and finance, plus growing and scaling-up businesses. Speakers include Newcastle City Council chief executive Pat Ritchie, best-selling author Brad Burton and Government business advisor Tony Robinson. 
Also speaking at the launch event was Newcastle Central MP and Shadow Minister for Industrial Strategy Chi Onwurah, who praised the event’s organisers. Read More True Potential profits hit £15m despite impact of Brexit and Trump 
She said: “It’s really fantastic to be in such a large room full of so many Geordie and North Eastern entrepreneurs. That isn’t how I usually spend my time and it’s great to see so many people who are so determined to fulfill their dreams and also start something which can grow and contribute to the success of our city.” 
More details on this week’s events can be found at https://newcastlestartupweek.com/ . Like us on Facebook
